title.narrative: PDMEAL Support for Financial Inclusion Endline Assessment

description.narrative:
In the Pilot phase, the Financial Inclusion Pilot project has already seen 875 VSLA Members have been trained on Financial and Adult Literacy, addressing systemic illiteracy within the targeted rural communities. As a result, 195 Members can now read, write and sign their names – a key barrier to engaging with many financial services and products. 8 VSLA Members now have bank accounts, which is a 200% increase from the start of the pilot. Moreover, 5 VSLA Groups are now operating as Mobile Money Agents; further contributing to income generation within the respective communities and there has been 180% increase in VSLA Members with mobile money accounts.
The project has funding for all the components involved except for an Endline Assessment. In a relatively short period of time, the project has made significant gains and the data gained from partner narrative reports already indicate a positive impact. However, in order to properly assess and document the successes and failures of this project, with an aim towards securing funding for a second phase, there is a need to hire a consultant to conduct a thorough endline assessment. This will help determine our strengths when looking forward to future projects, while also determining the efforts of KADDRO and the VSLAs for financial sustainability.
